text: Jackson County is a county in the U.S. state of Missouri. In 2020, the population was 717,204. This county has the second-highest number of people in the state, after St. Louis County. It has two county capitals, Independence and Kansas City. The county was created December 15, 1826. It was named for President Andrew Jackson (elected 1828). ==References== Category:Missouri counties Category:1820s establishments in Missouri Category:1826 establishments in the United States
title: Jackson County, Missouri
